entry.title: Li Fu Lee (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Li Fu Lee (pictured), the first Chinese woman to attend MIT, studied electrical engineering, which—according to The Boston Globe—its undergraduates at the time said was its hardest major?

entry.title: Still Life with Books (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Still Life with Books by Jan Lievens is an example of the vanitas genre of painting?

entry.title: Thanos (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Digital Domain created a new facial-capture system to help create the look of Thanos in Avengers: Infinity War and Avengers: Endgame?

entry.title: Margaret Cote (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Saulteaux linguist Margaret Cote was the first person in Saskatchewan to teach a First Nations language in a public school?

entry.title: censored by the military dictatorship (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that newspapers in Brazil printed cake recipes and 16th-century poetry to cover material censored by the military dictatorship?

entry.title: Lovely's Purchase (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that President James Monroe promised the eastern Cherokee a "gateway to the setting sun" where they were not "surrounded by the White man", which resulted in the creation of Lovely's Purchase?

entry.title: Vladlen Tatarsky (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that blogger Vladlen Tatarsky was killed by a bomb hidden in a bust of himself?

entry.title: Untitled Goose Game (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Untitled Goose Game escaped being called Some Like It Honk?
